About Me

My name is Matthew Ryan Evans, and I am a freelance front-end developer. I am proficient in HTML, CSS, and Javascript. I am currently studying Software Development at Western Governors University. The thing that excites me most about technology is that we have advanced to a state where we (the thinkers, the dreamers) are no longer bound by hardware limitations, but solely limited by the depth of our own imagination and ingenuity. If you dream it I can build it, these are the words I live by.

CPR-N-MORE.COM

CPR-N-MORE is a St. Louis based CPR and AED training company. Founded in 2006 I was one of the first independent contractors hired by the company tasked with creating mainting there online presence. The site is not just a landing page for there company, but also acts at the hub for the companys event planning and class roster system. Durring the early days of CPR-N-MORE the site also had an ecomerce component to it where they sold AED uints, this has since been removed form the website as of 2017 I no longer manage the CPR-N-MORE website.

OnMax

OnMax was developed to solve the issue enterpise was having in regards to the slow onboarding practices that dragged the process out of multipule days. I was taked with creating a solution.
Utilizing VBA and Excel I created a set of macros that streamlined and automized the process for onboarding personal to create the nessisary documents that they needed to complet there daily tasks.
OnMax has the ability to import data from the windows clipboard, and then the end user can choose how they would like the data formated. The key benifit of this software was that the orginal data was around 100 rows of 50 coloms each, and the export of any one specific document would only need 4 - 8 of thoughs coloms, but each export needed diffrent information. OnMax digested this information and exported the nessisary files in less than a 10th of the time that it could be done by hand, saving time money and fatigue. This software is still currently inuse by Enterprise's Onboarding department, a second version is also currently in development.
